intro: Thlaspi vitorogense, commonly known as the Vitorian cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of four-petaled flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open habitats. Thlaspi vitorogense is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
